org.commonvox.insight.anomaly_detector

Class TransactionProcessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.commonvox.insight.anomaly_detector.TransactionProcessor

  • public class TransactionProcessor
extends Object
    The TransactionProcessor class serves as the primary API for the "anomaly_detector" package, with methods for both batch and streaming invocations.
    Author:
    Daniel Vimont

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TransactionProcessor(String batchPathString)
      Initializes a new TransactionProcessor, which reads in startup parameters and initializing transactions from a batch file (e.g., "batch_log.json") for which a relative path is identified by the submitted parameter.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void processPathInput(Path path, String anomalyPathString)
      Provides for a batch processing alternative to real-time stream processing in situations in which streaming data has been previously captured and stored in a file (e.g., "stream_log.json"), and it is subsequently being submitted for anomaly-detection processing.
      void processPathStringInput(String pathString, String anomalyPathString)
      Provides for a batch processing alternative to real-time stream processing in situations in which streaming data has been previously captured and stored in a file (e.g., "stream_log.json"), and it is subsequently being submitted for anomaly-detection processing.
      void processStreamInput(Stream<String> stream, BufferedWriter anomalyWriter)
      Provides for real-time stream processing of transactions being submitted for anomaly-detection processing.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • TransactionProcessor

        public TransactionProcessor(String batchPathString)
                     throws IOException,
                            org.json.simple.parser.ParseException
        Initializes a new TransactionProcessor, which reads in startup parameters and initializing transactions from a batch file (e.g., "batch_log.json") for which a relative path is identified by the submitted parameter.
        Parameters:
        batchPathString - String representation of local relative path for an existing batch file (e.g., "batch_log.json") containing startup parameters and initializing transactions.
        Throws:
        IOException - if file access problems encountered
        org.json.simple.parser.ParseException - if problems encountered in parsing of JSON input

    • Method Detail

      • processPathStringInput

        public final void processPathStringInput(String pathString,
                                         String anomalyPathString)
                                  throws IOException,
                                         org.json.simple.parser.ParseException
        Provides for a batch processing alternative to real-time stream processing in situations in which streaming data has been previously captured and stored in a file (e.g., "stream_log.json"), and it is subsequently being submitted for anomaly-detection processing.
        Parameters:
        pathString - String representation of local relative path for an existing file (e.g., "stream_log.json") for anomaly-detection processing.
        anomalyPathString - String representation of local relative path for output file (which need not yet exist) which is to receive outputted anomaly records in JSON format.
        Throws:
        IOException - if file access problems encountered
        org.json.simple.parser.ParseException - if problems encountered in parsing of JSON input

      • processPathInput

        public final void processPathInput(Path path,
                                   String anomalyPathString)
                            throws IOException,
                                   org.json.simple.parser.ParseException
        Provides for a batch processing alternative to real-time stream processing in situations in which streaming data has been previously captured and stored in a file (e.g., "stream_log.json"), and it is subsequently being submitted for anomaly-detection processing.
        Parameters:
        path - Path representation of local relative path for an existing file (e.g., "stream_log.json") for anomaly-detection processing.
        anomalyPathString - String representation of local relative path for output file (which need not yet exist) which is to receive outputted anomaly records in JSON format.
        Throws:
        IOException - if file access problems encountered
        org.json.simple.parser.ParseException - if problems encountered in parsing of JSON input

      • processStreamInput

        public final void processStreamInput(Stream<String> stream,
                                     BufferedWriter anomalyWriter)
                              throws org.json.simple.parser.ParseException,
                                     IOException
        Provides for real-time stream processing of transactions being submitted for anomaly-detection processing. Note that this method is also internally invoked by other TransactionProcessor method(s) which convert batch file records into streaming records.
        Parameters:
        stream - stream of transactions being submitted for anomaly-detection processing.
        anomalyWriter - BufferedWriter object to receive outputted anomaly records in JSON format.
        Throws:
        IOException - if file access problems encountered
        org.json.simple.parser.ParseException - if problems encountered in parsing of JSON input
